content.question: Spencer took a 9 percent one-year fixed-rate loan to buy a new car. He expected to pay a real interest rate of 5 percent. If at the end of the year Spencer only paid a 3 percent real interest rate, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The nominal interest rate was <math alttext="3 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The nominal interest rate was <math alttext="5 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The actual inflation rate was <math alttext="2 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The actual inflation rate was <math alttext="4 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The actual inflation rate was <math alttext="6 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The actual inflation rate was <math alttext="6 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
